qas.question: What would you describe the shape of the football?
How many players are on each team?
What happens when both teams score the same amount of points?
What is the captain a part of before the start of the game?
What is another name for the football?
What would not describe the shape of the football?
How many players are excluded from each team?
What happens when both teams score different amounts of points?
What is the captain a part of after the end of the game?
What is a banned name for the football?

context: Association football is played in accordance with a set of rules known as the Laws of the Game. The game is played using a <a0_0><b5_0>spherical<b5_0/><a0_0/> ball of 68.5–69.5 cm (27.0–27.4 in) circumference, known as the football (or <a4_0><b9_0>soccer ball<b9_0/><a4_0/>). Two teams of <a1_0><b6_0>eleven<b6_0/><a1_0/> players each compete to get the ball into the other team's goal (between the posts and under the bar), thereby scoring a goal. The team that has scored more goals at the end of the game is the winner; if both teams have scored an equal number of goals then the game is <a2_0><b7_0>a draw<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Each team is led by a captain who has only one official responsibility as mandated by the Laws of the Game: to be involved in <a3_0><b8_0>the coin toss<b8_0/><a3_0/> prior to kick-off or penalty kicks.
